events.description: Expected to keep rates on hold at 3.75%

facts.fact_text: FTSE 100 traded lower on Thursday after hitting a record high in the previous session.

evidences.evidence_text: FTSE 100 traded lower on Thursday after hitting a record high in the previous session

facts.fact_text: Vodafone fell almost 5% after reporting slower than expected service revenue growth.

evidences.evidence_text: Vodafone led declines, falling almost 5% after reporting slower than expected service revenue growth

facts.fact_text: Shell dropped around 1.5% as quarterly profit slightly missed forecasts, though the group announced another $3.5 billion share buyback.

evidences.evidence_text: Shell dropped around 1.5% as quarterly profit slightly missed forecasts, though the group announced another $3.5 billion share buyback.

facts.fact_text: Anglo American slipped about 1% after cutting its 2026 copper production forecast due to weaker expected output from Chile.

evidences.evidence_text: Anglo American slipped about 1% after cutting its 2026 copper production forecast due to weaker expected output from Chile.

facts.fact_text: BT rose more than 1% after a trading update showed third quarter adjusted EBITDA in line with estimates and confirmed it remains on track to meet full year guidance.

evidences.evidence_text: BT rose more than 1% after a trading update showed third quarter adjusted EBITDA in line with estimates and confirmed it remains on track to meet full year guidance.

evidence.evidence_text: as investors turned cautious ahead of the Bank of England decision expected to keep rates on hold at 3.75%
Vodafone led declines, falling almost 5% after reporting slower than expected service revenue growth
Anglo American slipped about 1% after cutting its 2026 copper production forecast due to weaker expected output from Chile.
